comment_text: This post is a powerful testament to the strength of diverse leadership and a growth-mindset culture at Meta. Seeing Hind Hobeika, Kelly Ingham, Ming Hua, and Shira Gordon share their journeys is incredibly motivating. The key takeaways resonate deeply: 1. "Nonlinear paths embraced" is a crucial message. It validates the experiences of so many professionals whose careers aren't a straight ladder, but a mosaic of skills, pivots, and learning. 2. "Curiosity fueled their rise" highlights that in fast-moving fields like wearables and AI, technical skill must be paired with a relentless desire to learn and question. 3. The tangible outcome of "5 products shipped in one year" proves that this leadership style isn't just inspirationalâ€”it's exceptionally effective and execution-oriented. By showcasing these women leaders at Grace Hopper, Meta does more than share career tips; it actively models the future of tech: one that is innovative, human-centric, and built by a wide range of perspectives. This is how you redefine careers and build the next generation of products. Thank you to the panelists and Julia L. for sharing these insights. This is the content that changes aspirations. #WomenInTech #LifeAtMeta #GraceHopper2025 #Future

comment_text: Meta is lucky that I am not a US citizen. Has Meta abandoned the foundational models Llama , now that Avagardo has been brought into the picture? Question to CTO: Given that the US military uses Llama , through third parties ( eg, Oracle Predictions, Andurl Helmets) , how would you explain the introduction of Avagardo at the expence of or as an enhancement of Llama, to the Chairman of Joint Chiefs of Staff ( CJCS)? Had I been a US citizen, I would have taken the next available flight to Pentagon and would have requested the CJCS to immediately ring up Meta HQ to ask that very question. It is that serious. "Don't ask what the country has done for you, ask what have you done for the country". This would have been the moment I lived for. The ideal candidate is an American Mother with her days old baby in her arms, requesting the CJCS to ring up Meta HQ and requests the CJCS to kiss her baby on the forehead and give his blessings, so the baby serves as a distinguished fighter pilot in US Air Force Or Navy, when s/he is old enough. comment_text: Impressive engineering achievement â€” scaling GEM required exactly the kind of data, infra, and cross-team coordination most companies never reach. But thereâ€™s an important point beneath all of this: larger ad-foundation models still operate inside a short-horizon optimisation loop. They excel at prediction and generation, yet they do not maintain a persistent internal model of why they make the decisions they make. In my research on external self-maintenance architectures (eTSM-PSS7), we consistently find that the bottleneck isnâ€™t scale or training throughput â€” itâ€™s identity stability and long-horizon value coherence. Without a stable self-model, any high-capacity recommender eventually drifts: semantic drift, preference drift, and alignment drift. GEM pushes the ceiling of scale. The next leap will be pushing the ceiling of cognitive continuity â€” ensuring that large-scale generative recommenders donâ€™t just optimise, but understand their own long-term behaviour.

comment_text: I need to issue a serious warning to my network regarding Meta (Facebook/Instagram). We are seeing a predatory pattern that is destroying small businesses. The cycle is becoming impossible to ignore: The Shadowban: Perfectly healthy accounts suddenly lose all organic reach. The Disable: Accounts are flagged or disabled by AI bots with zero human review. The "Upsell": Immediately after crippling reach, the platform pushes you to "Boost" posts or buy Ads to regain visibility. This isn't a glitch; it feels like a feature. It is a "pay-to-play" trap designed to extract revenue from businesses that have no other options. Because they hold a monopoly on social connection, there is zero accountability. There is no customer support, only automated loops. To my fellow business owners: Do not rely solely on these platforms. They can shut off your livelihood with the flip of a switch and demand a ransom in ad spend to turn it back on. Diversify your marketing immediately.

comment_text: Meta Meta Facebook Seeking help here because nothing else Iâ€™ve tried has worked. I have a personal Facebook account with a business page tied to it, for my growing art business. I created an Instagram account and linked the two accounts, at the suggestion of Facebook. comment_text: SAM 3 makes "image viewing, object finding, and segmentation" more intelligent, and can even provide phrases or examples as hints, demonstrating that visual models are moving from "passive recognition" to "controllable understanding." SAM 3D further caters to the explosive demand for 3D content in VR/AR, design, and film, reconstructing 3D from a single image, significantly impacting the barrier to entry for future content creation. Overall, visual models are upgrading from "recognition" to "multi-dimensional understanding + content production," and the developer toolchain is becoming increasingly powerful. I strongly agree with this direction: AI is not just seeing the world, but understanding and reconstructing it more accurately and flexibly. This is good for research, products, and even ordinary creators.

While achieving 100% will be challenging, this direction sends an inspiring message to all industries.

comment_text: Metaâ€™s new Ray-Ban display glasses promise seamless AI and intuitive visual information, but should everything be made smart? These AI glasses raise important concerns. Continuous data overlays and voice prompts risk increasing mental fatigue and distraction, especially while driving or in social settings. Human attention is limited, and flooding it with constant information may compromise safety and cognitive health. There are ethical issues too: recording or analyzing others without their permission is a challenge to privacy, trust, and social etiquette. Living through a lens could make our world less authentic and more artificial. Innovation is invaluable, but responsible design and real societal reflection must come first. Just because technology can "augment" our senses doesnâ€™t mean it should "invade" them!!! ğŸ™„ #Meta #Stocks #Facebook #AI #Techlology #Privacy #MentalHealth #Innovation #SmartGlasses #BigTech #StockMarket #MetaStock
